docs.snippet: Last Sunday afternoon the annual Super Bowl game was watched by 70 million viewers, one of the largest audiences ever to gather before their TV sets. Tens of millions of fans will be watching this afternoon's pro basketball Game of the Week and to...
docs.lead_paragraph: Last Sunday afternoon the annual Super Bowl game was watched by 70 million viewers, one of the largest audiences ever to gather before their TV sets. Tens of millions of fans will be watching this afternoon's pro basketball Game of the Week and tomorrow night's Pro Bowl football all-star game. Broadcasts of sports events are the TV industry's hottest items and the commentators who cover them are emerging as stars in their own right.
docs.abstract: Rocco Landesman article compares present day sportscasting and sportscasters with those of '50's and '60's; notes greater emphasis today on entertainment; illus of sportscasters Pat Summerall, Don Meredith and Howard Cosell (L)

headline.main: Hey, Sportscasters! Where's that Old College Try?

docs.snippet: Dissatisfied with an earlier local investigation into allegations of corporal punishment in some Bronx schools, Chancellor Irving Anker has directed his special trustee in Community School District 9 to personally conduct a new investigation into ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Dissatisfied with an earlier local investigation into allegations of corporal punishment in some Bronx schools, Chancellor Irving Anker has directed his special trustee in Community School District 9 to personally conduct a new investigation into the charges.
docs.abstract: NYC School Chancellor Irving Anker, dissatisfied with earlier local investigation into allegations of corporal punishment at JHS 22, pss 53, 64 and 114, Bronx, directs special trustee in Bronx Community School Dist 9, Alfredo Mathew Jr, to personally conduct new investigation into charges; orders new investigation after being informed number of teachers at PS 53, Bronx, disputed June '74 findings made by asst principal there; corporal punishment incident in May '74 at Dist 9, which resulted in reprimand of principal William E Green and suspension of deans Oscar Smith and John Mathis, revd; Anker will also begin series of planned staff conferences and training sessions and revision of principals' handbook, in effort to enable supervisors and teachers to cope more effectively with pupil-discipline problems (M)

headline.main: PADDLING INQUIRY ORDERED BY ANKER; Action Follows Complaints by District 9 Teachers on June Investigation
